results.title: Epilepsy: assessment and management
results.brief_description: Video footage of a 2001 satellite broadcast to country doctors through the Rural Health satellite network and “The Health Channel” which was also streamed on the web. A panel of experts comprising epileptologists, a clinical pharmacologist and a general practitioner discuss epilepsy, a common, misunderstood, misdiagnosed and often unrecognised condition affecting between 1-2% of the population. Emphasis is placed on treating individuals on a case by case basis and the importance of tailoring treatment to the individual. Myths surrounding the disease are explored, facts and figures provided, definitions, types of seizures, diagnosis, treatment, resources and an interview with Tony Grieg, diagnosed with epilepsy age 12. Also features 2 case studies. Norman Swan hosts the panel.

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance

results.title: Entropy
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure, bonding and the periodic law”
Professor L.J. Haynes and Dr R.A. Ross, assisted by Mr R. Andon of the National Physical Laboratory discuss experiments relating to the transfer of energy, illustrating the laws of thermodynamics and the concept of entropy.

results.title: Entombed warriors
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the partially excavated ‘Terracotta Army’ found at Xian in China. Explores the excavation techniques and the historical significance of the find.

results.title: Enthalpy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure Bonding and the Periodic Law”.
Professor Haynes of Open University explains the procedures involved in the National Physical Laboratory’s equipment to determine enthalpy changes. The process is compared to home/school laboratory calorimeters and used to discuss the theory of and problems associated with measuring energy changes in chemical reactions.

results.title: Enterprise in steam
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Brian Bosisto and Bosisto Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Pichi Pichi Railway Preservation Society and their efforts in re-opening 32 kilometres of historical railway track at Quorn in South Australia’s northern region. Apart from showing the restoration of steam locomotive carriages and bridges the film shows the spirit of enterprise in a community

results.title: Enter Exit Cave
results.brief_description: Shows the Exit Cave in South-West Tasmania and raises issues concerning the preservation of such sites as part of our heritage. Presents spectacular views of the cave system and its fragile environment. No credits available.

results.title: Enso: El Nino Southern Oscillation
results.brief_description: A very brief and effective diagrammatic explanation of ENSO, or the “El Nino” effect which periodically reverses the normal weather patterns of the Eastern Australian-Indonesian areas and South America. ENSO lasts about a year and weakens the usual easterly trade winds which bring warm air and rainfall so that the rain then falls mid-Pacific.
